hypothesis_content.title: News Catalyst Breakout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: A price breakout (2% move within 2 hours) occurring simultaneously with a major, scheduled news headline (e.g., CPI, Fed) is likely to reverse within 6 hours if the initial move exhausts above the 1H Bollinger Band and volume declines on subsequent candles.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Scheduled news often creates volatile, knee-jerk reactions that are faded by algorithmic and institutional flows, especially in a directionless (Neutral) market. The volume decline signals lack of follow-through. Recent Coinbase prediction market news could serve as a catalyst model.
entry_conditions: Scheduled high-impact news event occurs (macro, regulatory)
BTC price moves >2% in a direction within 2 hours of news
Price touches or exceeds the 1H 20-period Bollinger Band outer band
Volume on the 3rd 1H candle post-breakout is lower than on the 1st

exit_conditions.take_profit: Reversion to pre-news VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1H close beyond the outer Bollinger Band (breakout continues)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Over 60% of such news-driven breakouts continue in the initial direction for more than 6 hours, invalidating the 'fade' premise.
